sect2.title: HTTPSender
sect2.para: The HTTPSender can be used to send messages via HTTP protocol using POST method as default to the URL specified by the 'address' property. The HTTP method can be changed using the 'method' property. (for complete list of available methods see the java.net.HttpURLConnection class documentation)

The various scenarios can lead to a different HTTP response codes that are expected. The scenario can be set to expect one or more response codes. It can be set via 'expectedResponseCodes' property. Default expected response code is 200.
To set headers of the HTTP request use the 'header' element of the particular 'message' element in the 'messages' section of the scenario definition.

row.entry: URL of the target, where the message is send.
A comma separated list of HTTP response code(s) that is expected to be returned.
HTTP method to be used. It can be one of {GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS, PUT, DELETE, TRACE}
